title: Google Q4: Gemini Powers Google Ads; Cloud Continues Growth Momentum
text: Alphabet's advertising business is normalizing, with an 11% YoY growth in total advertising revenue, validating previous predictions. The expansion of Gemini, Alphabet's largest AI model, into core products like Google Ads has the potential to significantly impact the digital advertising market. Alphabet's cloud business achieved its first operating profits in FY23, with a 5.2% operating margin, and is expected to continue growing due to enterprise digitalization and AI initiatives.

title: Google signs its largest offshore power agreement with Dutch wind projects
text: Technology giant Google has signed its largest ever power purchase agreement (PPA) with offshore wind projects off the coast of the Netherlands as part of efforts to green its power supply and hit climate targets, it said on Thursday.

title: Should Investors Buy the Dip in Alphabet or Microsoft Stock After Earnings?
text: Over the last year, Alphabet and Microsoft's stock have soared +41% and +60% respectively and investors may be wondering if today's selloff is a buying opportunity.

title: YouTube Is A Streaming Giant No One Seems To Notice
text: Alphabet's GOOG latest earnings call grabbed lots of attention from investors hungry for news about how its many artificial-intelligence initiatives are turning cutting-edge technologies into oodles of dollars. But tucked inside the generally positive quarterly report were eye-popping figures for Alphabet's media operations, including YouTube and related subscription services.

title: Google parent Alphabet sees AI investment providing long-term opportunities
text: For Google parent Alphabet and its investors, the race to dominate artificial intelligence is a balancing act of spending against a potential payoff and an uncertain timetable.

title: Why Alphabet Stock Was Sliding Today
text: Alphabet topped estimates on the top and bottom lines in the fourth quarter. Ad revenue was slower than expected due to a decline in the Google Network segment.

title: Google parent Alphabet remains AI-driven growth story amid investor disappointment over 4Q results
text: Google parent company Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG)'s fourth quarter results may have disappointed investors but analysts at Wedbush remain bullish on the stock, reiterating their ‘Outperform' rating and $160 price target. “Alphabet reported health 4Q results with total revenue 1.3% above consensus and operating income (excluding one-time expenses) modestly ahead of expectations,” the analysts wrote in a note to clients.

title: Microsoft And Google Cloud Growth Impressed. Can Amazon Follow?
text: Analysts say Microsoft's and Google's cloud results are a positive sign for Amazon Web Services' fourth-quarter sales.

title: Alphabet Stock Is Down Today. Now Is the Time to Buy
text: Investors are finding flaws in earnings, but the long-term growth story for search, YouTube, and the cloud are still intact.

title: Google's first Africa cloud region now operational
text: Google has today said its cloud region in South Africa is operational, coming a year after the tech giant picked Johannesburg as its first site in Africa.

title: Alphabet Stock Dips After Ad Revenue Falls Short
text: Shares of Alphabet Inc   (NASDAQ:GOOGL) are pulling back sharply after the Big Tech powerhouse and Google parent's  fourth-quarter earnings report.

title: Missed Out on Nvidia? 2 AI Stocks to Buy Before They Soar in 2024.
text: Nvidia's stock soared nearly 240% last year, making it an expensive option for investing in AI. However, Alphabet is a far cheaper option with solid prospects in AI.

title: Morgan Stanley raises Microsoft, Google stock price targets after earnings
text: Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ: MSFT) and Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOGL) have sharply rallied in the trailing twelve months but a Morgan Stanley analyst is convinced both still have significant room to the upside.

title: Google's layoffs already impacted its culture. Now they're affecting its bottom line.
text: This post originally appeared in the Insider Today newsletter. You can sign up for Business Insider's daily newsletter here.

title: Alphabet Stock's a ‘Bargain' in the Magnificent Seven, Says Analyst
text: Its shares have slipped, but Alphabet, the parent of Google and YouTube, saw several price-target increases after earnings.

title: Dow Jones Today: Google Weighs on Nasdaq as Wall Street Awaits Fed Decision
text: Stock futures were mixed in premarket trading Wednesday as Google-parent Alphabet's shares tumbled in early trading following a good—but not quite good enough—quarterly earnings report.

title: Alphabet results could bode well for Amazon and Meta, says Wedbush
text: Google parent Alphabet's Inc.'s fourth-quarter results could spell good news for Amazon.com Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc. who are on deck this week, according to Wedbush analyst Dan Ives.

title: The Best AI Investment Right Now Is Obvious (Hint: It's Not Nvidia)
text: Nvidia's hardware model will eventually lead to a drop in demand. Alphabet's subscription model is far more sustainable.

title: 1 Surprising Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock This Billionaire is Pouring Money Into
text: Bill Ackman's Pershing Square loaded up on Alphabet stock in 2023. Ackman cited Alphabet's underappreciated AI upside as the reason.

title: Microsoft Has Three Trillion Reasons to Keep the Heat on Google
text: The software titan's value has set expectations high, but the latest results show clear momentum.

title: Investors punish Microsoft, Alphabet as AI returns fall short of lofty expectations
text: Tech giants on Tuesday talked up how customers are lapping up their generative AI-powered products, but mounting costs of developing the cutting-edge features irked investors hoping for a big boost to sales from the new technology.

title: Will Oracle Be Worth More Than Alphabet by 2030?
text: Oracle's stock has more than doubled over the past five years. Oracle's recent growth is largely driven by its cloud-based expansion.

title: $110 billion set to be wiped off Alphabet's valuation after Google owner's advertising revenues disappoint
text: Alphabet shares slid close to 6% in premarket trading Wednesday. The losses came after the Google owner posted earnings for the last three months of 2023.
